Package server

Class DBMenuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.DBMenuController
  • public class DBMenuController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used for all functions relating to updating menus, deleting dishes from menus, creating new menus and adding dishes to a restaurants specific menu Used in src/gui/menu with the controllers in src/controllers/menu
    Since:
    01.01.2022
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    muhamad abu assad

    • Method Detail

      • loadAllDishInRestaurant

        protected void loadAllDishInRestaurant​(java.lang.String[] res,
                                       ConnectionToClient client,
                                       java.sql.Connection myCon,
                                       DBController db)
        This method loads all dishes in a specific restaurant, not all dishes in restaurant are in the restaurant menu
        Parameters:
        res - used to start function, rest of res for details we need for queries res[0] load_all_dish_in_restaurant,res[1] RestaurantID
        client - The connection from which the message originated.
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
        db - the main database controller used in order to send message back to client

      • insertDishesToRestaurant

        protected void insertDishesToRestaurant​(java.util.ArrayList<DishInRestaurant> dishes,
                                        ConnectionToClient client,
                                        java.sql.Connection myCon,
                                        DBController db)
        This method inserts a dish to restaurant used in edit menu, if there is no menu create a new one else update the existing one.
        Parameters:
        dishes - dish we wish to add to Restaurant
        client - The connection from which the message originated.
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
        db - the main database controller used in order to send message back to client

      • createNewEmptyMenu

        protected int createNewEmptyMenu​(int restaurantNum,
                                 java.sql.Connection myCon)
        This method creates a new empty menu for a specific restaurant, called by InsertDishesToRestaurant
        Parameters:
        restaurantNum - restaurant we create a menu for
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB

      • editDish

        protected boolean editDish​(DishInRestaurant Dish,
                           java.sql.Connection myCon,
                           int menuId)
        This method edits a dish used when editing a dish in edit menu likee setting a new price etc
        Parameters:
        Dish - dish we update and it's data we insert
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB

      • insertDish

        protected boolean insertDish​(DishInRestaurant dish,
                             int addToMenu,
                             int menuId,
                             java.sql.Connection myCon)
        This method inserts a new dish into dishinrestaurant
        Parameters:
        dish - dish to insert along with it's data (price etc)
        addToMenu - is a flag we use if it's 1 we add to menu else we dont
        menuId - menu ID that we add the dish to
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
        Returns:
        true if dish was inserted, false else

      • addDishToMenu

        protected boolean addDishToMenu​(int restNum,
                                int dishID,
                                java.sql.Connection myCon)
        This method inserts a new dish into a menu
        Parameters:
        restNum - restaurant number we use to find it's menu
        dishID - the dish we add to menu
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB

      • createNewMenu

        protected void createNewMenu​(java.lang.String[] res,
                             ConnectionToClient client,
                             java.sql.Connection myCon,
                             DBController db)
        This method inserts a dish to restaurant used in edit menu, if there is no menu create a new one else update the existing one.
        Parameters:
        res - [0] used to start function, rest of res for details we need for queries
        res - [0]=Create_New_Menu
        res - [1]=Amount of dishes
        res - [2]=menuType
        res - [3]=RestaurantNum
        res - [[4]=menuID
        client - The connection from which the message originated.
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
        db - the main database controller used in order to send message back to client

        This method creates a new empty menu for a specific restaurant, called by InsertDishesToRestaurant
        Parameters:
        restaurantNum - restaurant we create a menu for
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB

      • addDish

        protected void addDish​(java.lang.String[] res,
                       ConnectionToClient client,
                       java.sql.Connection myCon,
                       DBController db)
        This method adds a new dish to our dish menu which you can later add to your menu or your restaurant
        Parameters:
        res - [0] used to start function, rest of res for details we need for queries
        res - [0]=Add_Dish
        res - [1]=Dish name
        res - [2]=Dish type
        client - The connection from which the message originated.
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
        db - the main database controller used in order to send message back to client

                            ConnectionToClient client,
                            java.sql.Connection myCon,
                            DBController db)
        This method removes a dish from a restaurants menu
        Parameters:
        dishes - = dish we wish to delete
        client - The connection from which the message originated.
        myCon - the connection to mySql DB
